'Albanian' ( or ) is an Indo-European language spoken by approximately 7.4
million people, primarily in Albania and Kosovo, but also in other areas of the
Balkans in which there is an Albanian population, including western Republic of
Macedonia, southern Montenegro, Bosnia and Italy. Centuries-old communities
speaking Albanian-based dialects can be found scattered in southern Bosnia,
southern
Italy, http://www.minorityrights.org/1617/italy/albanians.html Sicily,
and Ukraine. http://www.albanianlanguage.net/ As a result of a modern
diaspora, there are also Albanian speakers elsewhere in those countries and in
other parts of the world, including Scandinavia, Switzerland, Germany, United
Kingdom, Turkey, Australia, New Zealand, Netherlands, Singapore, Brazil, Canada,
and the United States.
categories: Languages of the Republic of Macedonia
